import React,{useContext, useState} from 'react' import userContext from '../Controllers/userContext' const OneOffer = () => { const userCon=useContext(userContext) const [infos,setInfos]=useState( { idCom:"5554684", title:"Full-Stack Dev", picture:"ibm.png", postDate:"4/6/2024", expireDate:"16/6/2024", field:"Technology", description:"Pour le compte de l'un de nos clients dans le secteur bancaire, nous recrutons des profils :âœ” Consultant DP\n - ActivitÃ© de MarchÃ©âœ” Consultant DP - International (Cash management)âœ” Consultant DP - International (ConformitÃ©, Risque et Finance)âœ”Consultant DP - Infrastructure & Production Minimum 10 d'XPðŸ“†Date de dÃ©marrage : ImmÃ©diateðŸ“ Poste basÃ© Ã  Casablanca", position:"Permanent", time:"Full-Time", presence:"OnSite", numDemands:0, companyName:"IBM" } ) const handleDelete=()=>{ } const handleApply=()=>{ } return (

{infos.companyName}

Posted : {infos.postDate}

{infos.title}

Field : {infos.field}

Presence : {infos.presence}

Position : {infos.position}

Full-time / Part-time : {infos.field}

{infos.description}

{ userCon.userType==="employer" && userCon.id===infos.idCom? : }
) } export default OneOffer
